message: and, because convore can be used in many ways. Here are just a few: 1) Chat with employees or co-workers about a project; 2) Have a secure conversation with a friend; 3) Use as a fast and easy landing page like I'm doing here; 4) Use as a back channel during a live broadcast for team members or audience feedback and chat. 5) as an e-mail replacement and much more.

Now you can add tweets inline. All you do is click on the time stamp for the tweet in question and that will take you to the URL for that specific tweet. Then copy and paste the URL here like this: http://twitter.com/#!/CraigShipp/status/53940315094122496

Get good group names while you still can. convore is still young and, for now, you can still get good, simple group names. For example I got the group name "Frederick" to use with my website http://Frederick.com But act NOW as group names are first come first served. If you setup groups on generic names like "Food" please make the group public so the entire community can benefit from such a short and easy name.
Craig, you are really onto something here! I can see many uses for convore for personal, business and community use. I'm all over this one.
@craig How do you hope to use the group with your website? I'm curious :o)

@Joltrast To add chat and for back channels. convore looks like a powerful communications tool that we will be able to use in many ways. The key is uptake. If convore takes off I can see it becoming a primary communications channel for our network.
And now there is an iPad app.
All you need is the image URL and paste it in a message and it appears inline: https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/_Gwl7nwYGqGo/TccSEoezoCI/AAAAAAACYbI/eiLFiNlgQ-A/s1024/RCS_4441.jpg
